alert.note: Alert for Beaverhead; Gallatin; Madison (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 4:34AM MST until December 24 at 6:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST FRIDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected for elevations above 6500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches for most locations, 2 to 6 inches for Big Hole and Chief Joseph Passes, 6 to 12 inches for Raynolds and Targhee Passes, with localized amounts over 12 inches south of West Yellowstone. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Beaverhead, Gallatin and Madison Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of snow expected tonight through Friday evening. The period of heaviest snowfall will be Thursday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
